article.headline: The Citadel 68, Wofford 65
article.story: SPARTANBURG, S.C. (AP) -- Kevin Hammack scored 15 points and Max Mombollet added 14 to lead The Citadel to a 68-65 victory against Wofford on Monday. The Citadel (5-21, 1-14 Southern Conference) built a 20-point first-half lead and then held off a frantic Wofford (8-18, 4-11) comeback. After Mombollet missed a free-throw attempt in the final seconds, he grabbed his own rebound and was fouled again. He made both his attempts to give the Bulldogs a 66-63 lead with 21 seconds left. After David Eaton missed a 3-pointer in the corner that would have tied the game, Dante Terry grabbed the defensive board and was fouled. He made 1-of-2 free-throws to give The Citadel a 67-63 lead with eight seconds left. Greg Taylor scored an uncontested layup to bring Wofford within 67-65 with three seconds to play. Hammack was then immediately fouled. After missing his first attempt, he made the second to provide the final margin. Howard Wilkerson led Wofford with 19 points and Adrien Borders added 18.
